title.narrative: United for Youth Employment in Cambodia

description.narrative: A United Nations Joint Programme (UNJP) developed to provide assistance to the Royal Government of Cambodia to address the critical issue of youth employment in the context of the rapidly growing, export-led national economy. It aims at facilitating young people’s entrance into the labour market, while reducing inequalities – particularly for disadvantaged and vulnerable groups - and ensuring young women and men are better able to meet labour demand. The UNJP is a partnership between the United Nations system and the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC). The UNJP capitalizes on the complementary mandates and areas of UN expertise, which, when pulled together, can more effectively contribute to address the challenge of youth employment in Cambodia. Hence the programme benefit from the combined strengths of ILO, UNDP, UNESCO, UNICEF and UNV. The cooperation of the participating agencies counts on additional resources secured from the organizations' core funding and from other donors.

participating-org.narrative: Switzerland, Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation

department.narrative: Departement of Partnerships and Field Support (PARDEV)

sector.narrative: ILO Results Framework 2020-2021: Output 3.1. Increased capacity of member States to formulate and implement a new generation of gender-responsive national employment policies, including for youth
